bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 10, 1897

div1.p: Lazear writes that he is returning to Baltimore. Mabel Lazear's mother wishes to meet Sweitzer, so Lazear suggests that she stay in the Boston area next season.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 10, 1897
div1.p:
I leave
for Baltimore tomorrow
morning. I have
not heard of Uncle
Tom's arrival there
but I want to be
sure to see him.

Please direct
letters care of Aunt
Kate for the present
Mrs. Houston is
delighted that you
are coming to Boston.
She will enjoy
sightseeing with
you. I think it
will be very nice
for you to see
Boston over again
with the many
new things since
you were there.
Mrs. Houston has
has not determined exactly
where to stay but all that
can be easily arranged in
plenty of time. I hope you
can run up here while you
are in Boston and see how
you would like it here for
another summer. This is
really a beautiful bit of
coast.
